solution_line_template: Two pairs of shoes at ${shoe_price} a pair costs ${shoe_price} x {num_shoes} = $<<{shoe_price}*{num_shoes}={total_shoe_price}>>{total_shoe_price}.

The shoes are discounted by {shoes_discount_percent} percent so she only pays {full_percent} - {shoes_discount_percent} = <<{full_percent}-{shoes_discount_percent}={shoes_pay_percent}>>{shoes_pay_percent} percent of the original price.
Therefore the two pairs of shoes cost ${total_shoe_price} x {shoes_pay_decimal} = $<<{total_shoe_price}*{shoes_pay_decimal}={discounted_shoes_cost}>>{discounted_shoes_cost}.

The dress is discounted by {dress_discount_percent} percent so she only pays {full_percent} - {dress_discount_percent} = <<{full_percent}-{dress_discount_percent}={dress_pay_percent}>>{dress_pay_percent} percent of the original price.
In total Daniela spends ${discounted_shoes_cost} + ${discounted_dress_cost} = $<<{discounted_shoes_cost}+{discounted_dress_cost}={total_spent}>>{total_spent} for two pairs of shoes and a dress.
